keyColor.description: Color of the module key. Left empty to use `display.color.keys`

keyWidth.description: Width of the module key. Use 0 to use `display.keyWidth`

keyIcon.description: Set the icon to be displayed by `display.keyType: "icon"`

outputColor.description: Output color of the module. Left empty to use `display.color.output`

oneOf.description: 1 for percentage number, 2 for multi-color bar, 3 for both, 6 for bar only, 9 for colored number, 10 for monochrome bar

green.description: Value less then green will be shown in green

yellow.description:
Value greater than green and less then yellow will be shown in yellow.
Value greater than yellow will be shown in red

temperature.description: Detect and display temperature if supported

green.description: Value (in celsius) less then green will be shown in green

yellow.description:
Value (in celsius) greater than green and less then yellow will be shown in yellow.
Value greater than yellow will be shown in red

batteryFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Battery`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {manufacturer}: Battery manufacturer
    2. {model-name}: Battery model name
    3. {technology}: Battery technology
    4. {capacity}: Battery capacity (percentage num)
    5. {status}: Battery status
    6. {temperature}: Battery temperature (formatted)
    7. {cycle-count}: Battery cycle count
    8. {serial}: Battery serial number
    9. {manufacture-date}: Battery manufactor date
    10. {capacity-bar}: Battery capacity (percentage bar)
    11. {time-days}: Battery time remaining days
    12. {time-hours}: Battery time remaining hours
    13. {time-minutes}: Battery time remaining minutes
    14. {time-seconds}: Battery time remaining seconds

biosFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Bios`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {date}: Bios date
    2. {release}: Bios release
    3. {vendor}: Bios vendor
    4. {version}: Bios version
    5. {type}: Firmware type

bluetoothFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Bluetooth`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Name
    2. {address}: Address
    3. {type}: Type
    4. {battery-percentage}: Battery percentage number
    5. {connected}: Is connected
    6. {battery-percentage-bar}: Battery percentage bar

bluetoothradioFormat.description:
Output format of the module `BluetoothRadio`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Radio name for discovering
    2. {address}: Address
    3. {lmp-version}: LMP version
    4. {lmp-subversion}: LMP subversion
    5. {version}: Bluetooth version
    6. {vendor}: Vendor
    7. {discoverable}: Discoverable
    8. {connectable}: Connectable / Pairable

boardFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Board`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Board name
    2. {vendor}: Board vendor
    3. {version}: Board version
    4. {serial}: Board serial number

bootmgrFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Bootmgr`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Name / description
    2. {firmware-path}: Firmware file path
    3. {firmware-name}: Firmware file name
    4. {secure-boot}: Is secure boot enabled

brightnessFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Brightness`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {percentage}: Screen brightness (percentage num)
    2. {name}: Screen name
    3. {max}: Maximum brightness value
    4. {min}: Minimum brightness value
    5. {current}: Current brightness value
    6. {percentage-bar}: Screen brightness (percentage bar)

btrfsFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Btrfs`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Name / Label
    2. {uuid}: UUID
    3. {devices}: Associated devices
    4. {features}: Enabled features
    5. {used}: Size used
    6. {allocated}: Size allocated
    7. {total}: Size total
    8. {used-percentage}: Used percentage num
    9. {allocated-percentage}: Allocated percentage num
    10. {used-percentage-bar}: Used percentage bar
    11. {allocated-percentage-bar}: Allocated percentage bar
    12. {node-size}: Node size
    13. {sector-size}: Sector size

cameraFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Camera`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Device name
    2. {vendor}: Vendor
    3. {colorspace}: Color space
    4. {id}: Identifier
    5. {width}: Width (in px)
    6. {height}: Height (in px)

chassisFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Chassis`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {type}: Chassis type
    2. {vendor}: Chassis vendor
    3. {version}: Chassis version
    4. {serial}: Chassis serial number

commandFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Command`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {result}: Command result

cpuFormat.description:
Output format of the module `CPU`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Name
    2. {vendor}: Vendor
    3. {cores-physical}: Physical core count
    4. {cores-logical}: Logical core count
    5. {cores-online}: Online core count
    6. {freq-base}: Base frequency (formatted)
    7. {freq-max}: Max frequency (formatted)
    8. {temperature}: Temperature (formatted)
    9. {core-types}: Logical core count grouped by frequency
    10. {packages}: Processor package count

cpucacheFormat.description:
Output format of the module `CPUCache`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {result}: Separate result
    2. {sum}: Sum result

cpuusageFormat.description:
Output format of the module `CPUUsage`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {avg}: CPU usage (percentage num, average)
    2. {max}: CPU usage (percentage num, maximum)
    3. {max-index}: CPU core index of maximum usage
    4. {min}: CPU usage (percentage num, minimum)
    5. {min-index}: CPU core index of minimum usage
    6. {avg-bar}: CPU usage (percentage bar, average)
    7. {max-bar}: CPU usage (percentage bar, maximum)
    8. {min-bar}: CPU usage (percentage bar, minimum)

cursorFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Cursor`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {theme}: Cursor theme
    2. {size}: Cursor size

datetimeFormat.description:
Output format of the module `DateTime`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {year}: Year
    2. {year-short}: Last two digits of year
    3. {month}: Month
    4. {month-pretty}: Month with leading zero
    5. {month-name}: Month name
    6. {month-name-short}: Month name short
    7. {week}: Week number on year
    8. {weekday}: Weekday
    9. {weekday-short}: Weekday short
    10. {day-in-year}: Day in year
    11. {day-in-month}: Day in month
    12. {day-in-week}: Day in week
    13. {hour}: Hour
    14. {hour-pretty}: Hour with leading zero
    15. {hour-12}: Hour 12h format
    16. {hour-12-pretty}: Hour 12h format with leading zero
    17. {minute}: Minute
    18. {minute-pretty}: Minute with leading zero
    19. {second}: Second
    20. {second-pretty}: Second with leading zero
    21. {offset-from-utc}: Offset from UTC in the ISO 8601 format
    22. {timezone-name}: Locale-dependent timezone name or abbreviation
    23. {day-pretty}: Day in month with leading zero

deFormat.description:
Output format of the module `DE`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {process-name}: DE process name
    2. {pretty-name}: DE pretty name
    3. {version}: DE version

displayFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Display`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {width}: Screen configured width (in pixels)
    2. {height}: Screen configured height (in pixels)
    3. {refresh-rate}: Screen configured refresh rate (in Hz)
    4. {scaled-width}: Screen scaled width (in pixels)
    5. {scaled-height}: Screen scaled height (in pixels)
    6. {name}: Screen name
    7. {type}: Screen type (Built-in or External)
    8. {rotation}: Screen rotation (in degrees)
    9. {is-primary}: True if being the primary screen
    10. {physical-width}: Screen physical width (in millimeters)
    11. {physical-height}: Screen physical height (in millimeters)
    12. {inch}: Physical diagonal length in inches
    13. {ppi}: Pixels per inch (PPI)
    14. {bit-depth}: Bits per color channel
    15. {hdr-enabled}: True if high dynamic range (HDR) mode is enabled
    16. {manufacture-year}: Year of manufacturing
    17. {manufacture-week}: Nth week of manufacturing in the year
    18. {serial}: Serial number
    19. {platform-api}: The platform API used when detecting the display
    20. {hdr-compatible}: True if the display is HDR compatible
    21. {scale-factor}: HiDPI scale factor
    22. {preferred-width}: Screen preferred width (in pixels)
    23. {preferred-height}: Screen preferred height (in pixels)
    24. {preferred-refresh-rate}: Screen preferred refresh rate (in Hz)

diskFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Disk`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {size-used}: Size used
    2. {size-total}: Size total
    3. {size-percentage}: Size percentage num
    4. {files-used}: Files used
    5. {files-total}: Files total
    6. {files-percentage}: Files percentage num
    7. {is-external}: True if external volume
    8. {is-hidden}: True if hidden volume
    9. {filesystem}: Filesystem
    10. {name}: Label / name
    11. {is-readonly}: True if read-only
    12. {create-time}: Create time in local timezone
    13. {size-percentage-bar}: Size percentage bar
    14. {files-percentage-bar}: Files percentage bar
    15. {days}: Days after creation
    16. {hours}: Hours after creation
    17. {minutes}: Minutes after creation
    18. {seconds}: Seconds after creation
    19. {milliseconds}: Milliseconds after creation

diskioFormat.description:
Output format of the module `DiskIO`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {size-read}: Size of data read [per second] (formatted)
    2. {size-written}: Size of data written [per second] (formatted)
    3. {name}: Device name
    4. {dev-path}: Device raw file path
    5. {bytes-read}: Size of data read [per second] (in bytes)
    6. {bytes-written}: Size of data written [per second] (in bytes)
    7. {read-count}: Number of reads
    8. {write-count}: Number of writes

dnsFormat.description:
Output format of the module `DNS`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {result}: DNS result

editorFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Editor`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax

    4. {full-path}: Full path of real path

    9. {manufacture-week}: Nth week of manufacturing in the year

netioFormat.description:
Output format of the module `NetIO`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {rx-size}: Size of data received [per second] (formatted)
    2. {tx-size}: Size of data sent [per second] (formatted)
    3. {ifname}: Interface name
    4. {is-default-route}: Is default route
    5. {rx-bytes}: Size of data received [per second] (in bytes)
    6. {tx-bytes}: Size of data sent [per second] (in bytes)
    7. {rx-packets}: Number of packets received [per second]
    8. {tx-packets}: Number of packets sent [per second]
    9. {rx-errors}: Number of errors received [per second]
    10. {tx-errors}: Number of errors sent [per second]
    11. {rx-drops}: Number of packets dropped when receiving [per second]
    12. {tx-drops}: Number of packets dropped when sending [per second]

osFormat.description:
Output format of the module `OS`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax

    9. {version-id}: Version ID of the OS
    10. {codename}: Version codename of the OS
    11. {build-id}: Build ID of the OS
    12. {arch}: Architecture of the OS

packagesFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Packages`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {all}: Number of all packages
    2. {pacman}: Number of pacman packages
    3. {pacman-branch}: Pacman branch on manjaro
    4. {dpkg}: Number of dpkg packages
    5. {rpm}: Number of rpm packages
    6. {emerge}: Number of emerge packages
    7. {eopkg}: Number of eopkg packages
    8. {xbps}: Number of xbps packages
    9. {nix-system}: Number of nix-system packages
    10. {nix-user}: Number of nix-user packages
    11. {nix-default}: Number of nix-default packages
    12. {apk}: Number of apk packages
    13. {pkg}: Number of pkg packages
    14. {flatpak-system}: Number of flatpak-system app packages
    15. {flatpak-user}: Number of flatpak-user app packages
    16. {snap}: Number of snap packages
    17. {brew}: Number of brew packages
    18. {brew-cask}: Number of brew-cask packages
    19. {macports}: Number of macports packages
    20. {scoop}: Number of scoop packages
    21. {choco}: Number of choco packages
    22. {pkgtool}: Number of pkgtool packages
    23. {paludis}: Number of paludis packages
    24. {winget}: Number of winget packages
    25. {opkg}: Number of opkg packages
    26. {am-system}: Number of am-system packages
    27. {sorcery}: Number of sorcery packages
    28. {lpkg}: Number of lpkg packages
    29. {lpkgbuild}: Number of lpkgbuild packages
    30. {guix-system}: Number of guix-system packages
    31. {guix-user}: Number of guix-user packages
    32. {guix-home}: Number of guix-home packages
    33. {linglong}: Number of linglong packages
    34. {pacstall}: Number of pacstall packages
    35. {mport}: Number of mport packages
    36. {qi}: Number of qi packages
    37. {am-user}: Number of am-user (aka appman) packages
    38. {pkgsrc}: Number of pkgsrc packages
    39. {nix-all}: Total number of all nix packages
    40. {flatpak-all}: Total number of all flatpak app packages
    41. {brew-all}: Total number of all brew packages
    42. {guix-all}: Total number of all guix packages

physicaldiskFormat.description:
Output format of the module `PhysicalDisk`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {size}: Device size (formatted)

    3. {interconnect}: Device interconnect type
    4. {dev-path}: Device raw file path

    9. {revision}: Product revision
    10. {temperature}: Device temperature (formatted)

Output format of the module `WM`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {process-name}: WM process name
    2. {pretty-name}: WM pretty name
    3. {protocol-name}: WM protocol name
    4. {plugin-name}: WM plugin name
    5. {version}: WM version

wifiFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Wifi`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {inf-desc}: Interface description
    2. {inf-status}: Interface status
    3. {status}: Connection status
    4. {ssid}: Connection SSID
    5. {bssid}: Connection BSSID
    6. {protocol}: Connection protocol
    7. {signal-quality}: Connection signal quality (percentage num)
    8. {rx-rate}: Connection RX rate
    9. {tx-rate}: Connection TX rate
    10. {security}: Connection Security algorithm
    11. {signal-quality-bar}: Connection signal quality (percentage bar)
    12. {channel}: Connection channel number
    13. {band}: Connection channel band in GHz

wmthemeFormat.description:
Output format of the module `WMTheme`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {result}: WM theme

zpoolFormat.description:
Output format of the module `Zpool`. See `-h format` for formatting syntax
    1. {name}: Zpool name
    2. {state}: Zpool state
    3. {used}: Size used
    4. {total}: Size total
    5. {used-percentage}: Size percentage num
    6. {fragmentation-percentage}: Fragmentation percentage num
    7. {used-percentage-bar}: Size percentage bar
    8. {fragmentation-percentage-bar}: Fragmentation percentage bar

title: JSON config
description: JSON config file for fastfetch. Usually be `~/.config/fastfetch.jsonc`

$schema.description: JSON schema URL, for JSON validation and IDE intelligence

oneOf.description: Set the source file of the logo

type.description: Set the type of the logo given

source.description: Set the source file of the logo

color.description: Overwrite a color in the logo

width.description: Set the width of the logo (in characters). Required for iTerm image protocol

height.description: Set the height of the logo (in characters). Required for iTerm image protocol

padding.description: Set the padding of the logo

top.description: Set the top padding of the logo

left.description: Set the left padding of the logo

right.description: Set the right padding of the logo

printRemaining.description: Whether to print the remaining logo, if it has more lines than modules to display

preserveAspectRatio.description: Whether to preserve the aspect ratio of the logo. Supported by iTerm image protocol

recache.description: If true, regenerate image logo cache

position.description: Set the position of the logo should be displayed

chafa.description: Chafa configuration. See chafa document for details

fgOnly.description: Produce character-cell output using foreground colors only

symbols.description: Specify character symbols to employ in final output

canvasMode.description: Determine how colors are used in the output. This value maps the value of enum ChafaCanvasMode.

colorSpace.description: Set color space used for quantization. This value maps the value of enum ChafaColorSpace.

ditherMode.description: Set output dither mode (No effect with 24-bit color). This value maps the value of enum ChafaDitherMode.

multithreading.description: Use multiple threads to detect values

escapeBedrock.description: On Bedrock Linux, whether to escape the bedrock jail

playerName.description: The name of the player to use for module Media and Player. Linux only

dsForceDrm.description: Force display detection to use DRM. Linux only

oneOf.description: Try `libdrm` first, then `sysfs` if libdrm failed

wmiTimeout.description: Set the timeout (ms) for WMI queries, `-1` for no timeout. Windows only

processingTimeout.description: Set the timeout (ms) when waiting for child processes, `-1` for no timeout

preRun.description: Set the command to be executed before printing logos

detectVersion.description: Whether to detect and display component versions. Mainly for benchmarking

display.description: Configure how things to be displayed

stat.description: Show time usage (in ms) for individual modules with optional threshold

pipe.description: Whether to enable pipe mode (disable logo and all escape sequences)

showErrors.description: Print occurring errors to the console. False to ignore errored modules

disableLinewrap.description: Whether to disable line wrap during the run

hideCursor.description: Whether to hide the cursor during the run

separator.description: Set the separator between key and value

color.description: Set the color of the keys and title

oneOf.description: Set the both color of the keys and title

keys.description: Set the color of the keys

title.description: Set the color of the title

output.description: Set the color of the module output

separator.description: Set the color of the key-value separator

brightColor.description: Set if the keys, title and ASCII logo should be printed in bright color

key.description: Set how module keys should be displayed

width.description: Align the width of keys to number of characters, 0 to disable

type.description: Set whether to show icon before string keys

paddingLeft.description: Set the left padding of keys

size.description: Set how a size value should be displayed

binaryPrefix.description: Set the binary prefix to used when formatting sizes

maxPrefix.description: Set the largest binary prefix to use when formatting sizes

ndigits.description: Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when formatting sizes

temp.description: Set how temperature values should be displayed

unit.description: Set the unit of the temperature

ndigits.description: Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when formatting temperature values

color.description: Set color used in different states of temperature values

charElapsed.description: Set the character to use in elapsed part

charTotal.description: Set the character to use in total part

borderLeft.description: Set the string to use at left border

borderRight.description: Set the string to use at right border

width.description: Set the width of the bar, in number of characters

percent.description: Set how a percentage value should be displayed

ndigits.description: Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when formatting percentage numbers

color.description: Set color used in different states of percentage bars and numbers

freq.description: Set how frequency values should be displayed

ndigits.description:
Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point when formatting frequency values
A positive value will show the frequency in GHz of decimal
-1 will show the frequency in MHz

noBuffer.description: Whether to disable the stdout application buffer

constants.description: List of strings to be used in custom format of modules

type.description: Print a empty line
Print battery capacity, status, etc

useSetupApi.description: Set if `SetupAPI` should be used on Windows to detect battery info, which supports multi batteries, but slower. Windows only

type.description: Print information of 1st-stage bootloader (name, version, release date, etc)
List (connected) bluetooth devices

showDisconnected.description: Set if disconnected bluetooth devices should be printed

type.description: List bluetooth radios width supported version and vendor
Print motherboard name and other info
Print information of 2nd-stage bootloader (name, firmware, etc)
Print current brightness level of your monitors

ddcciSleep.description:
Set the sleep times (in ms) when sending DDC/CI requests.
See <https://www.ddcutil.com/performance_options/#option-sleep-multiplier> for detail

compact.description: Set if multiple results should be printed in one line

type.description: Print Linux BTRFS volumes
Print available cameras
Print chassis type (desktop, laptop, etc)
Print CPU name, frequency, etc

showPeCoreCount.description: Detect and display CPU frequency of different core types (eg. Pcore and Ecore) if supported

type.description: Print CPU cache sizes
Print CPU usage. Costs some time to collect data

separate.description: Display CPU usage per CPU logical core, instead of an average result

waitTime.description: Wait time (in ms). CPU usage = (inUseEnd - inUseStart) / waitTime

type.description: Print some colored blocks

paddingLeft.description: Set the number of white spaces to print before the symbol

width.description: Set the block width in spaces

range.description: Set the range of colors in the blocks to print

type.description: Running custom shell scripts

shell.description:
Set the shell program to execute the command text
Default: cmd for Windows, /bin/sh for *nix

param.description:
Set the parameter used when starting the shell
Default: /c for Windows, -c for *nix

text.description: Set the command text to be executed

type.description: Print cursor style name
Print a custom string, with or without key

key.description: Leave empty not to print the key

type.description: Print current date and time
Print resolutions, refresh rates, etc

compactType.description: Set if all displays should be printed in one line

preciseRefreshRate.description: Set if decimal refresh rates should not be rounded into integers when printing

order.description: Set the order should be used when printing

type.description: Print partitions, space usage, disk type, etc

folders.description:
A colon (semicolon on Windows) separated list of folder paths for the disk output
Default: auto detection using mount-points
This option overrides other `show*` options

showExternal.description: Set if external volume should be printed

showHidden.description: Set if hidden volumes should be printed

showSubvolumes.description: Set if subvolumes should be printed

showReadOnly.description: Set if read only volumes should be printed

showUnknown.description: Set if unknown (unable to detect sizes) volumes should be printed

useAvailable.description: Use f_bavail (lpFreeBytesAvailableToCaller for Windows) instead of f_bfree to calculate used bytes

type.description: Print physical disk I/O throughput

namePrefix.description: Show disks with given name prefix only

detectTotal.description: Detect total bytes instead of current rate

waitTime.description: Wait time (in ms). Disk I/O = (totalBytesEnd - totalBytesStart) / waitTime

type.description: Print desktop environment name

slowVersionDetection.description:
Set if DE version should be detected with slow operations.
Should be unnecessary for most cases.

type.description: Print DNS servers

showType.description: Specify the type of DNS servers should be detected

type.description: Print information of the default editor ($VISUAL or $EDITOR)
Print system font names
List connected gamepads
Print GPU names, graphic memory size, type, etc

driverSpecific.description: Use driver specific method to detect more detailed GPU information (memory usage, core count, etc)

detectionMethod.description: Force using a specified method to detect GPUs

hideType.description: Specify the type of GPUs should not be printed

type.description: Print product name of your computer
Print icon style name
Print init system (pid 1) name and version
Print system kernel version
Print login manager (desktop manager) name and version
List local IP addresses (v4 or v6), MAC addresses, etc

showAllIps.description:
Show all IPs bound to the same interface.
By default only the first IP is shown

compact.description: Show all IPs in one line

namePrefix.description: Show IPs with given name prefix only

defaultRouteOnly.description: Show ips that are used for default routing only

type.description: Print system load averages

ndigits.description: Set the number of digits to keep after the decimal point

type.description: Print system locale name
Print song name of currently playing
Print system memory usage info
Alias of Display module (for backwards compatibility, deprecated)
Print network I/O throughput

namePrefix.description: Show IPs with given name prefix only

defaultRouteOnly.description: Show ips that are used for default routing only

detectTotal.description: Detect total bytes instead of current rate

waitTime.description: Wait time (in ms). Disk I/O = (totalBytesEnd - totalBytesStart) / waitTime

type.description: Print highest OpenCL version supported by the GPU
Print highest OpenGL version supported by the GPU

library.description: Set the OpenGL context creation library to use

type.description: Print OS / or Linux distro name and version
List installed package managers and count of installed packages

disabled.description: List of package managers to be disabled when detecting

type.description: Print physical disk information

namePrefix.description: Show disks with given name prefix only

type.description: Print system physical memory devices
Print music player name
Print power adapter name and charging watts
Count running processes
Print your public IP address, etc

url.description: The URL of public IP detection server to be used. Only HTTP protocol is supported

timeout.description: Time in milliseconds to wait for the public ip server to respond

ipv6.description: Whether to use IPv6 for public IP detection server

type.description: Print a separator line

string.description: Set the string to be printed by the separator line

outputColor.description: Set the color of the separator line

length.description: Set the length of the separator line, or 0 to auto-detect

type.description: Print current shell name and version
Print sound devices, volume, etc

soundType.description: Set what type of sound devices should be printed

type.description: Print swap (paging file) space usage
Print current terminal name and version
Print font name and size used by current terminal
Print current terminal size
Print current terminal theme (foreground and background colors)
Print current theme of desktop environment
Print title, which contains your user name, hostname

fqdn.description: Set if the title should use fully qualified domain name

color.description: Set colors of the different part of title

user.description: Set color of the user name (left part)

at.description: Set color of the @ symbol (middle part)

host.description: Set color of the host name (right part)

type.description: Print info of Trusted Platform Module (TPM) Security Device
Print users currently logged in

compact.description: Show all active users in one line

type.description: Print how long system has been running
Print Fastfetch version
Print highest Vulkan version supported by the GPU
Print image file path of current wallpaper
Print weather information

timeout.description: Time in milliseconds to wait for the weather server to respond

outputFormat.description: The output weather format to be used (must be URI encoded)

type.description: Print connected Wi-Fi info (SSID, connection and security protocol)
Print window manager name and version

detectPlugin.description: Set if window manager plugin should be detected on supported platforms

type.description: Print current theme of window manager
Print ZFS storage pools
